title.value: Processing visual ambiguity in fractal patterns: Pareidolia as a sign of creativity
title.justification: The title clearly states the primary focus of the research, which is the examination of pareidolia as a creative process within ambiguous visual patterns.
title.quote: Processing visual ambiguity in fractal patterns: Pareidolia as a sign of creativity

extractions.description: The paper explores how highly creative individuals perceive forms in ambiguous visual stimuli, specifically focusing on the concept of pareidolia as a representation of creativity. It investigates the correlation between creativity and the ability to perceive pareidolic images using fractal patterns of varying dimensions and contrasts as stimuli.

type.justification: The study involves the collection and analysis of data from tasks where participants identify forms in visual stimuli, thereby providing empirical insights into the relationship between creativity and perception.
type.quote: Here, we examine the perceptual aspect of creativity by asking whether creative individuals are more likely to perceive recognizable forms in ambiguous stimuli –a phenomenon known as pareidolia.

name.justification: The study delves into the cognitive processes underlying creativity and perception, particularly focusing on how individuals recognize patterns in ambiguous stimuli, which fits well within the domain of cognitive science.
name.quote: Creativity is a highly valued and beneficial skill that empirical research typically probes using ‘‘divergent thinking’’ (DT) tasks such as problem solving and novel idea generation.

name.justification: The paper focuses on how individuals perceive and interpret visual stimuli, particularly focusing on pareidolia, a visual phenomenon.
name.quote: we examine the perceptual aspect of creativity by asking whether creative individuals are more likely to perceive recognizable forms in ambiguous stimuli –a phenomenon known as pareidolia.

name.justification: The study investigates the link between perception and creativity, a central theme in creativity research.
name.quote: These results extend the established body of work on DT by introducing divergent perception as a complementary manifestation of the creative mind, thus clarifying the perception-creation link while opening new paths for studying creative behavior in humans.

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of specific stimuli created by manipulating fractal dimensions and contrasts, which served as the main dataset for the experiments.
name.quote: To this end, we developed a pareidolia paradigm where 50 participants with various levels of creativity viewed a wide range of synthetic cloud-like images.
